data.title: Nice staff-but a little salesy
data.text: The hotel was great. A block over is Skid Row so be careful at night.  The hotel views were amazing and it was moderately clean.  I like things to be scrubbed clean and it could have used a little more of that.  Additionally, during my stay the elevators were SLOW.  Not fun to wait for.  The staff is helpful but wants you to use all their services and pay tips, extra but I understand

data.title: Business traveler sanctuary
data.text:
I stayed at this hotel for two nights while in town for a business meeting.  

Although the hotel is only about 15 miles from LAX, it took me a full 1 1/2 hours in LA traffic after leaving LAX at 6:30 p.m..  For my 8:00 a.m. return flight, I left the hotel at 5:05 a.m., and did not run into much traffic. I made it to LAX in 25 minutes.  Just something to keep in mind.

If you are using a GPS, be careful not to turn down Onuzuka Street, as this is a dead end and you cannot enter the hotel from this street (yes, I'm talking from experience here).

I used the valet parking, which was only a little bit more than the self parking ($40 vs. $25).  

I was greeted immediately at the front desk.  My king bed room was on the 5th floor.  I liked the style of the room.  The closet was large.  I was glad to see an in room refrigerator.  The bed was incredibly comfortable.  The room was spotlessly clean.  Like most center city hotels, the room was small, as was the bathroom.  However, it was plenty big for one person, and even two people would be OK.

I met my colleague for dinner at the hotel restaurant the first evening.  We sat at the bar and really enjoyed the bartender (sorry, I did not get his name, but he was originally from Chicago).  He was so funny, and provided great service.  They will let you sample the draft beers before you commit to one.  The food was tasty (I got the burger the first night and the fish and chips the second night).  

I walked around the neighborhood late in the afternoon on my second day.  The hotel is about a block from iconic City Hall.  There did not seem to be a lot of dining choices within an easy walk from the hotel that did not involve sushi (nothing against sushi). Of course, the hotel is adjacent to Little Tokyo. Yes, there were a lot of homeless people around, but not one was panhandling or said anything to me.  

The fitness center was well stocked with aerobic equipment - several ellipticals, bikes, and treadmills.  There were also free weights and a Universal type weight machine.  There were plenty of towels and sanitizing wipes.  I very much appreciated that the center was open 24/7, as I was working out at 3:30 a.m., prior to my 5:00 a.m. departure for the airport.  

The gift shop had a nice selection of souvenirs.  I got a cute Mickey Mouse night shirt for $20.

As others have mentioned, there is A LOT of street noise outside the hotel at night.  The LAPD is also only a block from the hotel.  The hotel does offer earplugs.  I have stayed in downtown Washington DC several times, and trust me, there are more sirens there in the middle of the night. I was at the Doubletree the days after Election Day, so basically ground zero for the protestors.  Luckily, I always carry advil p.m. and pretty much slept through the protests.

All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for the business traveler.

data.title: Perfect downtown LA hotel
data.text: Second stay here, great place.  Hotel staff was very friendly, rooms spotless and good sized, and its an easy walk to all the funky downtown LA has to offer.  Best surprise, they added a free 7am yoga class in the Garden outside!  (only 2 of us there but the instructor was great and did full 1 hour class)  Free HHonors breakfast was excellent too.

data.title: Great Downtown Hotel
data.text: I stayed at Doubletree hotel downtown because it was close to the surgery center where I was having outpatient surgery. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The best thing is that they offered a shuttle to and from the surgery center. That is huge in that area with all the traffic even though it was only a few miles away.

data.title: Nice hotel
data.text: I've stayed at this hotel a few times.  Recently stayed in a suite (room 1923).  It's not fancy, but I found the hotel and room to be very clean and quite comfortable.  The bed was very comfortable and we got a good night's sleep.  The hotel itself was very quiet.  One time in the middle of the night a police siren outside woke me up.  To me, that is to be expected when staying in downtown LA.  Hotel staff at check-in and check-out were very friendly.  I would definitely stay here again.

data.title: Not worth the price and the walk to downtown
data.text:
An outdated hotel requiring renovation. 
Room has a air conditioning noice which disturbed my sleep. To add to it the sirens of police cars early morning in downtown area couldn't be avoided even on the 11th floor. Wifi is a total disaster in this hotel. Keeps breaking every minute. Bathroom size is very small. The room size is ok. Sleep quality is fine with king size bed. Breakfast is below average with very basic spread. The staff is courteous and willing to help. 

Overall I'd give it a miss for my next trip to LA downtown.

data.title: Good location for downtown LA  near courthouse
data.text: Great location , near courthouse and other venues in downtown LA. Within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping.  A bit of a distance from LAX, so rental car or cab.  Valet parking is  expensive, (but then this IS downtown). they  also have self parking underground.  Nice and calming lobby area. Room is comfortable, but 4 stars only due to city traffic noise.

data.title: On our way to HOLLYWOOD
data.text: Very Very nice Hotel in Downtown Los Angeles.  We only stayed here one night but had booked 2 nights.  We thought we had booked closer to Hollywood but found out we were wrong upon arrival.  Stayed one night after visiting Malibu and Venice beaches that day.  The guy at the front desk was so helpful in making arrangements for us to move closer to Hollywood the next day. We were greeted with not only smiles and welcomes but with warm cookies and water.  The hotel and rooms were extremely clean.

data.title: A bit far from the Santa Monica, Venice and Beverly Hills.
data.text:
The fact that the hotel is candid about its noise problem (a notice is put in your room upon arrival, offering earplugs), is honorable on their part.

Nevertheless, even with earplugs, I was awakened by street noises
.
Reviewers extol the fact that the hotel is situated right next to a freeway. Ok. Only if you like driving bumper to bumper.  A trip to Santa Monica can take hours.
We ended up using the Metro (not crowded and very clean) to go to Universal Studios which happened to be less stressful and less time-consuming. Plus, you save the parking fees. Mind you, you need a car anyway, in LA to get around.

Staff was professional except for the breakfast personnel who proved to be the most disappointing part.  They never propose what you would like to drink.  We were staying for 5 nights which is a relative long stay.  They never seemed to care if regular customers or not. Two different persons will ask the same question : your room number.  And they choose their guests to serve.  Luis will cater and clean the tables right next to us, but completely ignore us.  Spiteful servers are the worst lot. Wished we had not chosen the prepaid breakfast package.  On the other hand, the young server Leslie seemed the only one to manifest some warmth.

Contrary to others we did not find the area to be dodgy. 

The room was spacious for the three of us with an empty fridge, a coffee machine and an ironing table. No microwave. TV channel choices were good but be careful with your children.  While browsing I was surprised to fall on the sick movie “Funny Games”, during prime time.
The bathroom was one of the smallest I have ever come by.

Except for Korean BBQs, the choices of eating outside the hotel, were not abundant.

owner_response.author: John-HiltonHelp, on behalf of the staff at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear PIERRE-QUI-ROULE,

I’m sorry we were not able to provide you with a satisfactory experience during your recent stay.  Your satisfaction is very important to us, and we appreciate your feedback about noise. I apologize that even with the ear plugs, this was an issue. As well, we’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service at breakfast. We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that the next time you’re in the area you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service. Thank you again for your comments.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not so bad!
data.text: Hotel was nice, just didn't like the location. Near too many homeless people. I was afraid to walk the streets alone. Restaurant was really delicious, except for the wings. They were too big and not cooked long enough. Because of the area, I probably wouldn't stay here again. Also had to wait too long for a taxi in the a.m.

data.title: Gem in downtown LA
data.text: Courteous and personable welcome at the front desk.  The warm cookies was a nice touch.  Although this is an older property, maintenance was good overall.  The best and nicest experience was the garden level - perfect place to feel grounded and relaxed.  What a nice surprise after a hectic day of travel/sightseeing knowing that just below on the street was a crowd of people, traffic, and sirens.

data.title: A treat in store
data.text: We have stayed at this hotel before hence the reason for returning. We were warmly greeted on arrival, check in was quick and very simple. Our room was clean, very well appointed and quiet and the bed oh sooooo comfortable with soft  pillows you just sank into. Buffett breakfast was excellent, and our waiter couldn't do enough for us. Check out, like check in, was quick and extremely efficient. From our experience would recommend any one to stay here, the staff were so helpful. Will stay again when I return to LA.

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Dirtdiver15, I love hearing about returning guests! that is our ultimate goal for all guests; is to have them return and enjoy themselves each time!

Thank you for the kind words

Orlando Salazar
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quiet as on the outskirts of downtown.
data.text:
I was here for a conference being held on the other side of town at the convention center and thankfully there were free shuttle buses provided at regular intervals, as otherwise it's a 45minute walk. Location is ok ... but the area around (Japan Town and the walk to Union Station) seemed slightly dodgy. 

The room was lovely and quite spacious. I had 2 queen beds. There was a desk between, a big screen TV and a 'couch'. The pillows were my least favourite part of the room as they flatten to nothing by the middle of the night but the bed itself was comfortable. The bathroom was very small, but functional with a nice strong shower, over the bath. Best of all was how quiet things were overnight. There was very little in-room noise and I couldn't hear noise from the rooms next door. Occasionally you heard sirens but that's to be expected for inner city hotels.

I was on level 21 and the wifi single was strong and reliable but colleagues on lower floors complained that it dropped out a lot.

Breakfast was served in the Justice Tavern. The first morning I had the full buffet, including a freshly made omelette but on other mornings I just had the granola/fruit which was about half the price and just as filling.

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Seabird21, thank you for taking a moment to review your stay. I am sorry that our location was not did not leave you with a better impression. 

I am happy to share that we are in final stages of a massive overhaul to our wifi system and hope that these reoccurring issues will be resolved very shortly 

Orlando
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The aircon was so loud, the pool needs to open earlier, The Staff were great.....
data.text: We couldn't sleep with the air conditioner on, so loud. The pool doesn't open till 10am, not sure why!. The restaurant has a great bar and very friendly and helpful staff, the front desk ladies were always happy to help.

owner_response.author: Calvin P, On behalf of the hotel staff at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues in your room and we’re working with our maintenance team to ensure the situation doesn’t happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again and give us an opportunity to show improvement.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice hotel, but location was iffy
data.text: The room was good - very comfortable bed and nice but small bathroom.  We had dinner one night in the hotel restaurant - average food with good service.  The entire hotel staff was friendly and helpful throughout my 4 night visit.  My only concern was the location of the hotel.  It seemed to be a bit outside of the main hotel area within the business district where the majority of other hotels were located.  There were few other people walking around at night and many homeless people were camped nearby.  I would not walk around the area by myself at night.

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello rick19348, thank you for the feedback you provided us. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay. I will share your thoughts on the food quality of our restaurant with our culinary team. 

I am sorry that the local area; left something to be desired for you but I am confident that all the initiatives that our local leaders are launching will serve to clean up our area further!

Orlando
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good hotel if you get it for a good price
data.text:
This is not a 5 star hotel, but it does everything you need a Downtown hotel to do.  We wanted to be close to Japan town to look around the area, and the location was perfect for us.  We did get woken up by noise and sirens during the night but they offer you ear plugs for this (although you have to request them), if it bothers you then take them up on the offer.  
Unfortunately we could smell smoke it certain parts of the hotel but our room was smoke free so that was fine.  The beds were nice.

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello sandram972016, thank for your taking a moment to review your recent stay. I appreciate the detailed feedback; this will assist us in improving our offerings and we will be reviewing how we can better serve our guests in regards to our earplugs delivery. 

I am sorry that you smelled smoke; while we are a smoke free hotel; at times some guests take liberties with our policies. We work tirelessly to ensure that all guests follow our policies. 

Orlando Salazar
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good location downtown
data.text: We spent two nights here post cruise. The hotel has good big rooms, friendly staff and is very clean. The concierge gave us good tips of how to get around and helped us organize a day tour. We walked around the area during day as it seemed quite safe

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello 228Kevin, thank you for taking a moment to review your recent stay with us. I am happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and furthermore we were able to provide you with some good exploring options!!

Orlando Salazar
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Management was very helpful, easy to work with
data.text: I lost a memory card while a guest at this hotel earlier in the month and when it didn't turn up I had to return to LA to re-copy records at the nearby L. A. County Superior Court. Management gave me a rate I could afford. This was really a blessing since it was on my dime. The hotel also provides free computer usage and printing, which saved me a lot. The hotel was efficient and casual, located near the court house, Union Station and Olvera St. There is no pool but the exercise room is open around the clock. There is also a house car that gives a free lift to places near the hotel, by reservation.

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello PalofPerashon, thank you for the kind reviews, I am very pleased to read that we were able to turn around this negative experience for you

Thank you

Orlando Salazar
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Tired Hotel
data.text:
I just returned from a four day business trip to LA.  My business was downtown and I typically try to stay at Hilton hotels because my husband and I are HHonors members.  

Pros-
The service was good.  We ordered room service twice, had drinks and dinner in the lobby bar when we arrived and had nightcaps in the restaurant (Justice) each evening when we got back from dinner out.  On all occasions, the service was fast, friendly and efficient. Bar service was excellent and we actually saw one of the bartenders deal with a problem patron in a professional manner.  I thought the wine selection was so so. 

The food exceeded expectations.  We had breakfast on two occasions.  Everything was fresh and hot.  The night we arrived late, we shared an order of peel and eat shrimp and a Caesar salad.  The presentation was nice, the shrimp was fresh and the salad was crisp.  The rest of our meals were eaten out, but overall, we had a good experience with the food.

The staff was pleasant and friendly.  We were greeted by staff and asked if we needed anything on several occasions, including a phone call.

The bed was very comfortable (as I think is pretty consistent with Hilton).

There was plenty of hot water and the water pressure was decent.

Cons-

The hotel is very tired and is in major need of renovations.  The lobby was nondescript.  The rooms were small.  The ceilings are popcorn.  Although, clean, there was definitely no wow factor to this hotel.

Being downtown, there was a lot of noise.  I think there was a note that if earplugs were needed, the front desk had a stock.  We heard police sirens on many occasions.  This did not necessarily bother us, but if you are sensitive to noise, this may be something that is worth consideration.

The satellite television was spotty at best.  Some channels worked better than others and channels did not come in at all.

The biggest con was that I could not connect to wifi the whole time I was there.  Being a business trip, I needed to work, but was unable to do so without eating my data.  I called the first day and the person at the front desk tried to connect me to "IT" but after being put on hold, I was informed by an automated voicemail that I was unauthorized to be put through the call.  I called the front desk again, and this time she put me through to AT&T.  After several minutes on hold, I gave up.  The wifi remained an issue the entire stay.  

In summation, this was an okay experience.  As always, the cookies were warm and good!

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Susan, thank you for the feedback you shared about your recent stay with us, I am sorry that we did not make a better impression. Reading the review; demonstrated to me that we did not shine as we normally do; we have high expectations for us and how we deliver our service. I will speak with our associates in regards to this review and ensure that we address this ill behavior

Orlando
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Okay, not great.
data.text: The hotel itself was presented really nicely and we had a nice stay. The valets were so friendly, however we found the staff on reception quite rude and unhelpful throughout our trip, they wouldn't book a taxi for us or give us advice on how to get around. I also think it's a bit of a cheek having to pay so much for wifi each day. The location wasn't great either, was fine during the day but not so much at night.

owner_response.author: DoubletreeManagement, Director at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Los Angeles Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Aimee2790, Thank you for taking a moment to review our hotel. I am disappointed that we left much to be desired in regards to our Front Desk Team. I will personally ensure that each team member is addressed and is aware of how their behavior left such a negative impression on you. 

Orlando
owner_response.title: Owner Response
